newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iranian police seize more than 500 kg of drugs.
newsitem.headline: Iranian police seize more than 500 kg of drugs.

text.p: Iranian police seized 519 kg (1,145 lb) of drugs in the central province of Yazd over the past week, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said on Saturday.
The drugs seizure, which led to the arrest of eight smugglers, brought to 977 kg (2,150 lb) the total amount of narcotics confiscated in the province since May 22, IRNA said.

In a separate incident, police said they had busted a narcotics distribution gang in the northwestern province of West Azerbaijan in the past few days, arresting five smugglers and seizing 1.7 kg (3.75 lb) of cocaine, IRNA said.

According to Iranian law, possession of five kg (11 lb) of opium or 30 grams (just over one ounce) of heroin is punishable by death. More than 1,000 people have been executed in drug-related cases since the law took effect in 1989.
Iran is a key transit route for drugs, mostly opium from which heroin is made, being smuggled to Europe via Turkey from Afghanistan and Pakistan.
